any idea?

This stackoverflow answer contains a much improved version of a bash only po merge driver : <https://stackoverflow.com/a/68799310/436792|https://stackoverflow.com/a/68799310/436792>

I think it would be a great idea to replace you bash file with his.

text:
oh, how nice :slightly_smiling_face: sometimes the 3-way merger just fails .. so thus the requests to manually fix things

```Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bin/po3way", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
             ^^^^^^
  File "/home/weblate/.local/lib/python3.11/site-packages/po3way.py", line 166, in main
    (tmpdir / "local.po").write_text(unwrap(args.local.read_text()))
                                            ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.11/pathlib.py", line 1059, in read_text
    return f.read()
           ^^^^^^^^
  File "<frozen codecs>", line 322, in decode
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xfc in position 752: invalid start byte```

text:
taking a step back, maybe `potools:::get_po_messages()` can help? <https://github.com/MichaelChirico/potools/blob/a069329b77a0b425942c60efdf6e2d8102329b13/R/get_po_messages.R#L7>

that will at least give us a data structure to compare from target vs. source, rather than a text-only diff. doesn't look like `po3way` attempts this...

root.text: <@U01N3ET8N82> it seems that the base R repo got a git conflict in the automated rebase .. and it needs manual intervention. is it something you have time to do or should I look into it?

elements.text: it seems that the base R repo got a git conflict in the automated rebase .. and it needs manual intervention. is it something you have time to do or should I look into it?

text: the conflicts have been fixed and the components are now unlocked, so all users should be able to continue with the translations -- sorry it took so look, and thanks for your patience!

elements.text: the conflicts have been fixed and the components are now unlocked, so all users should be able to continue with the translations -- sorry it took so look, and thanks for your patience!

text: if you see anything odd that might be due to manual resolution of any git conflicts, please let us know :zipper_mouth_face: :pray:
